_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: VPS
author: Matheunsn.biolowons@gmail.com
description:
💎 Egg: VPS
⚙️ Version: 2.1
❓ What is it: A VPS, this egg uses Proot (FakeRoot) which tricks the system saying that you are a superuser, installing a Pterodactyl inside another Pterodactyl has never felt so real!

• It is in no way recommended to use Root in Docker. I am not responsible for any damage/action that you will do with it.\ n • • At least 1GB of space is required
 • Debian/Ubuntu distributions may take more than 15min to finish installation
 • Ubuntu distributions are currently not working

🐛 Bugs fixed/changelogs:
 • (1.0) Release. 
 • (2.0) Detects whether the Egg is up to date or not.
 • (2.0) Possibility to change Linux Distribution: (Debian, Ubuntu, Alpine). 
 • (2.0) Updated arguments, now the system is not so restricted.
 • (2.0) Possibility to change arguments.
 • (2.0) Run\ Shutdown command, now it is not necessary to kill the server anymore.
 • (2.0) Startup fix is needed, now the Panel knows that the Server is on.
 • (2.0) Installation Script has been rebuilt
 • (2.1) Serious Script bugs fixed
 • (2.1) Possibility of switch root between: PRoot(Default), PRoot-rs, FakechRoot + FakeRoot.
 • (2.1) Clean Install Added

📝 New Variables • (2.0) Your Arguments
 • (2.0) Linux Distribution
 • (2.1) • (2.0) ) Change Root
 • (2.1) Clean Install?

👑 Author: Ashu
👀 Check for updates: https://github.com/Ashu11-A/Ashu_eggs

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
mkdir -p /mnt/server > /dev/null
cd /mnt/server
mkdir libraries > /dev/null
echo "2.1" > libraries/version
echo "true" > libraries/version_system

variables.name: Use your arguments?
variables.description: Enable using your arguments? Don’t enable this if you don’t know what to do.

variables.name: Your Arguments
variables.description:
CAUTION, change only if you know what you are doing. If you want to put your own arguments, see PRoot Wiki: https://github.com/proot-me\ /proot/blob/master/doc/proot/manual.rst
Standard arguments are: -0 -r .-b /dev -b /proc -b / sys -w / -b .

variables.name: Linux distribution
variables.description: Select which Linux distribution you want the script to download. Currently these distributions are available: Debian, Ubuntu, Alpine.

variables.name: Change Root
variables.description: Change the root system. Currently there are these 3 types: PRoot(Default), PRoot-rs, FakechRoot + FakeRoot

variables.name: Clean install?
variables.description: With clean Setup the following packages will not be Installed: sudo wget hwloc htop nano neofetch python3 ngrok gotty curl
